author: m.kalinin
content:
It's useful for transaction confirmations. There are following states that block (and transactions in it) can be in the PoS network:
- `latest` -- head block, may not yet be attested; non-trivial probability to be re-orged
- `safe (justified)` -- block that has more than 2/3 votes; very unlikely to be re-orged (it would be an extreme case scenario); regularly is within `[32; 63]` range behind the head, with the improvement suggested by <@755590043632140352>  the range can be reduced to `[22; 54]`
- `finalized` -- block that maintains accountable safety property which means that `1/3` of a stake must be slashed in order to re-org such block; regularly is within `[64; 95]` range behind the head

There is an idea to improve `safe` block algorithm over time to reduce its distance behind the head, ideally to `[0; 1]` range. The work on that is being in progress

author: arnetheduck
content:
there's one more to that list:
- `committee-verified` - ie `head - 1` more or less, where the sync committee has voted for the parent of `head`

author: arnetheduck
content: it's what we get when using the light client protocol
